formattedAddress: 84 E 10th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 84 E 10th St, New York, NY 10003, USA

editorialSummary.text: Snug cafe whipping up traditional Chinese dumplings, homemade noodles, rougamo & rice dishes.

originalText.text: They have great noodles! I ordered Qishan noodle soup(N3) and Qishan dry noodle(N4). It was really delicious! And I loved their hand ripped noodle! I always missed that type of noodle that I had when I was studying in China. You have to order at the counter first and pay then you can pick up your food at the counter when they call your number. I loved their noodle I want to go back anytime soon :)!

text.text: They have great noodles! I ordered Qishan noodle soup(N3) and Qishan dry noodle(N4). It was really delicious! And I loved their hand ripped noodle! I always missed that type of noodle that I had when I was studying in China. You have to order at the counter first and pay then you can pick up your food at the counter when they call your number. I loved their noodle I want to go back anytime soon :)!

originalText.text: Their hand pulled noodles are really good, a bit chewy but soft. The broth is also not too heavy, it has a wonderful umami taste with light spice (I ordered it less spicy). The beef was also good, pretty tender for the price! Would highly recommend if you’re looking for hand pulled noodles or just a casual self-serve lunch/dinner place. Great for dining alone too.

text.text: Their hand pulled noodles are really good, a bit chewy but soft. The broth is also not too heavy, it has a wonderful umami taste with light spice (I ordered it less spicy). The beef was also good, pretty tender for the price! Would highly recommend if you’re looking for hand pulled noodles or just a casual self-serve lunch/dinner place. Great for dining alone too.

originalText.text: The hand pulled noodles with Lamb spicy curmin and the crispy pork pancakes were delicious. The staff were friendly and service was good. I highly recommend their noodles and crispy pancakes.

text.text: The hand pulled noodles with Lamb spicy curmin and the crispy pork pancakes were delicious. The staff were friendly and service was good. I highly recommend their noodles and crispy pancakes.

originalText.text:
Okay Xian food. Not as good as Xi'ans Famous. But totally okay as a substitute. The recipe is different of course so flavor is different. The portions are tad smaller than Xi'ans Famous.

Got the lamb cumin hand ripped noodle and was good enough. Not great but all the flavors are there. Small bits of lamb with mostly sprouts. Could have used more cilantro. Smaller portion of noodles and less meat compared to Xi'ans Famous.

The Diao Diao noodles were okay with shredded pork belly, bean sauce, scrambled eggs and tomatoes. Protion is a tad small with the hand ripped noodles. Good noodles with good savory flavor.

The pork and chives dumplings were below average. They were small. I would just skip the dumplings all together.

The lamb burger was alright with the flakey bun. This is better Xi'ans. With a nice portion of lamb.

The water basin mutton was okay as well. Sliced mutton with tofu and vermicelli. Soup was on the simple and clear side not heavy on flavor and it came with a flakey bun.

Overall this was an okay meal. Not really comparable to Xi'ans Famous. But as a quick substitute, it's okay.

originalText.text: My favourite place in the area for quick, tasty, and affordable food. I’ve yet to be disappointed by any of their noodle dishes. The garlicky and slightly numbing Xi’an Cold Noodles and the tangy and appetizing Tomatoes and Eggs are my favourites. The service is quick and attentive. They’re always thoughtful in waiting to make my takeout order when I’m also dining in so the takeout will be hot and fresh.
